column2: ALASKA PERMIT TEST
column4: Alaska
column6: AK

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. A four-way stop sign means:
column4: there are four stop signs at this intersection.
column6: traffic from all four directions must stop.
column8: if two vehicles reach the intersection at the same time, the driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.

column2: 2. ___________ normally are white rectangles with black letters or symbols.
column4: Destination signs (guide signs)
column6: Service signs

column2: 3. Which of the following must you obey over the others?
column4: A flashing red light.
column6: A stop sign.

column2: 4. Drivers approaching a stopped school bus with flashing amber lights should always:
column4: blow their horn and pass slowly.
column6: None of the other answers is correct.
column10: slow down and prepare to stop.

column2: 5. If you see a “lane closed ahead” sign you should:
column4: speed to the end of the closed lane and try to get into the other lane.
column6: merge into the correct lane when it is safe.
column8: make a U-turn. You are on the wrong side of the road.

column2: 6. When they see this sign, drivers:
column4: need to be prepared to turn right and then left quickly.
column6: should be prepared to make sharp turns at a high speed.
column8: should not speed up or brake quickly.

column2: 7. At intersections marked with stop lines, drivers must:
column4: come to a complete stop.
column6: signal other vehicles to stop.
column8: slow down and enter the intersection.
column10: enter the intersection and then stop.

column2: 8. The sign in the picture:
column4: is a Construction and Maintenance Traffic Control sign.
column6: is displayed on the rear of slow moving vehicles.
column8: means that you need to stop.
column10: is found at most intersections and indicates that drivers must yield to other vehicles.

column2: 9. You are entering a roadway from a private road, and you need to turn left. You have to yield to:
column4: vehicles from the left.
column6: pedestrians only.

column2: 10. Regulation signs normally are:
column4: blue rectangles.
column6: white triangles.

column2: 11. When driving in less than ideal conditions you should adjust your speed to:
column4: existing road conditions.
column6: other traffic.

column2: 12. A vehicle is stopped at a crosswalk to permit a pedestrian to cross the roadway. The driver of the vehicle approaching from the rear should:
column4: not overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.
column6: sound the horn.
column8: overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.

column2: 13. You are stopped at a stop sign and you are going to go straight through the intersection. A car on the cross road has stopped at a stop sign on your right and is going to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
column4: The car on your right.
column6: No one.

column2: 14. Vertical rectangles tell drivers:
column4: what is not allowed.
column6: that there's a school zone ahead.

column2: 15. To drive defensively, you must:
column4: not check behind you through your mirrors.
column6: assume that a driver who approaches a STOP sign on a side road is actually going to stop.
column10: use only one hand on the wheel.

column2: 16. This sign indicates:
column4: that you must not drive past this sign.
column6: that you must yield the right-of-way.
column8: the entrance to a construction site.
column10: the entrance to a dead-end street.

column2: 17. Aggressive driving includes:
column4: All of the above.
column6: chasing or challenging other drivers.
column8: quick lane changes without a signal.
column10: yelling, honking, gesturing at other drivers.

column2: 18. An inattentive driver:
column4: carries on an eye-contact conversation with a passenger while driving.
column6: gazes at objects off the roadway while driving.

column2: 19. Blind spots are:
column4: Areas to the side or rear of a vehicle that the driver cannot see with use of mirrors.
column6: Dangerous intersection where the maximum speed limit is 15 MPH or less.
column10: At night, the darkest areas of a road, where emergency flashers should be used.

column2: 20. Where must a pedestrian walk when there are no sidewalks?
column4: In the middle of the road, facing oncoming traffic.
column6: On the side of the road, in the same direction of traffic.
column8: On the side of the road, facing the traffic.
column10: On the left side of the road, behind slower vehicles.
